verses.name: Acts 27:12
verses.text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, and there to winter; which is an haven of Crete, and lieth toward the south west and north west.

verses.name: Acts 27:13
verses.text: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete.

verses.name: Acts 27:14
verses.text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.

verses.name: Acts 27:15
verses.text: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive.
